TITLE: Exporting Cluster Address
DESCRIPTION: This command exports the cluster address to the CLUSTER_ADDRESS environment variable. This variable is then used when pushing the Coder template. Requires shell access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/integrations/multiple-kube-clusters.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export CLUSTER_ADDRESS=https://example.domain:6443
```

TITLE: Deleting Organization Role via Curl - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to delete a custom organization role using the curl command-line tool. It requires the organization ID and role name as path parameters, along with the 'Coder-Session-Token' header for authentication.  The endpoint expects a DELETE request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/members.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X DELETE http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/organizations/{organization}/members/roles/{roleName} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Efficient React Testing Library Button Click
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates a more efficient way to click a button within a specific form element using React Testing Library's `within` function. By scoping the `getByRole` query to a smaller part of the DOM (the form), it reduces the number of elements the query needs to examine, improving performance. This approach leverages `getByTestId` to target the form element and then uses `within` to limit the scope of the `getByRole` query.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/contributing/frontend.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
const form = screen.getByTestId("form");
user.click(within(form).getByRole("button"));
```

TITLE: Generating Workspace Traffic with Coder CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command generates traffic similar to Coder's Web Terminal against existing workspaces. It uses `coder exp scaletest workspace-traffic` with options to define traffic parameters like bytes per tick, tick interval, timeout, target workspaces, tracing, Prometheus address, and output formatting. Environment variables and command arguments control traffic intensity, target workspaces, and monitoring endpoints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/infrastructure/scale-utility.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Produce load at about 1000MB/s (25MB/40ms).
coder exp scaletest workspace-traffic \
    --template "${SCALETEST_PARAM_GREEDY_AGENT_TEMPLATE}" \
    --bytes-per-tick $((1024 * 1024 * 25)) \
    --tick-interval 40ms \
    --timeout "$((delay))s" \
    --job-timeout "$((delay))s" \
    --scaletest-prometheus-address 0.0.0.0:21113 \
    --target-workspaces "0:100" \
    --trace=false \
  --output json:"${SCALETEST_RESULTS_DIR}/traffic-${type}-greedy-agent.json"
```

TITLE: Defining a Headless Service for Prometheus
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines a headless service in Kubernetes named `coder-prom` within the `coder` namespace, enabling Prometheus to discover and scrape metrics.  The service exposes port 2112 for Prometheus to scrape metrics. The `clusterIP: None` setting makes it headless.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/integrations/prometheus.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: coder-prom
  namespace: coder
spec:
  clusterIP: None
  ports:
    - name: prom-http
      port: 2112
      protocol: TCP
      targetPort: 2112
  selector:
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: coder
    app.kubernetes.io/name: coder
  type: ClusterIP
```

TITLE: Defining Coder App for RStudio

```
  }
}
```

TITLE: Wrapping Multiple API Calls - Typescript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a function that encapsulates multiple API calls into a single, higher-level operation. The `updateWorkspaceVersion` function first retrieves a template using `getTemplate` and then starts a workspace using `startWorkspace`, combining the results into a `WorkspaceBuild` object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/contributing/frontend.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```
export const updateWorkspaceVersion = async (
    workspace: TypesGen.Workspace,
): Promise<TypesGen.WorkspaceBuild> => {
    const template = await getTemplate(workspace.template_id);
    return startWorkspace(workspace.id, template.active_version_id);
};
```

TITLE: Ordering Coder Parameter Options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates that the order of options defined for Coder parameters is inherited from the file structure. This ensures that the order of options in the UI matches the order in the Terraform configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/resource-ordering.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Terraform
CODE:
```
data "coder_parameter" "database_region" {
  name         = "database_region"
  display_name = "Database Region"

  icon        = "/icon/database.svg"
  description = "These are options."
  mutable     = true
  default     = "us-east1-a"

  // The order of options is stable and inherited from .tf file.
  option {
    name        = "US Central"
    description = "Select for central!"
    value       = "us-central1-a"
  }
  option {
    name        = "US East"
    description = "Select for east!"
    value       = "us-east1-a"
  }
  ...
}
```

TITLE: Incorrect XState Service Definition
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows an incorrect implementation of an XState service definition.  By directly passing the `getUpdateCheck` function, the service will be invoked during machine creation rather than during state transitions.  This is a common mistake that can lead to unexpected behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/contributing/frontend.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```
import { getUpdateCheck } from "api/api"

createMachine({ ... }, {
  services: {
    getUpdateCheck,
  },
})
```

TITLE: Pushing Coder Template (Manual)
DESCRIPTION: Alternative commands for fetching Kubernetes secrets and pushing a Coder template when the automatic methods fail. This is particularly useful for Windows or when the jsonpath commands don't work as expected.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/integrations/multiple-kube-clusters.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Get cluster API address
kubectl cluster-info

# Get cluster CA and token (base64 encoded)
kubectl get secrets coder-service-account-token -n coder-workspaces -o jsonpath="{.data}"

coder templates push \
    --variable host=API_ADDRESS \
    --variable cluster_ca_certificate=CLUSTER_CA_CERTIFICATE \
    --variable token=CLUSTER_SERVICEACCOUNT_TOKEN \
    --variable namespace=coder-workspaces
```

```
curl -X PUT http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/oauth2-provider/apps/{app} \
```

TITLE: OpenShift BuildConfig Creation (Dockerfile)
DESCRIPTION: This command creates an OpenShift BuildConfig from a YAML definition provided via standard input. The BuildConfig defines how to build a Docker image from a Dockerfile. It specifies the source image, Dockerfile instructions to modify the user and group IDs, and the target ImageStreamTag where the built image will be stored. Requires OpenShift CLI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/openshift.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
oc create -f - <<EOF
kind: BuildConfig
apiVersion: build.openshift.io/v1
metadata:
  name: enterprise-base
  namespace: coder
spec:
  output:
    to:
      kind: ImageStreamTag
      name: 'enterprise-base:latest'
  strategy:
    type: Docker
    dockerStrategy:
      imageOptimizationPolicy: SkipLayers
  source:
    type: Dockerfile
    dockerfile: |
      # Specify the source image.
      FROM docker.io/codercom/enterprise-base:ubuntu

      # Switch to root
      USER root

      # As root:
      # 1) Remove the original coder user with UID 1000
      # 2) Add a coder group with an allowed UID
      # 3) Add a coder user as a member of the above group
      # 4) Fix ownership on the user's home directory
      RUN userdel coder && \
          groupadd coder -g 1000680000 && \
          useradd -l -u 1000680000 coder -g 1000680000 && \
          chown -R coder:coder /home/coder

      # Go back to the user 'coder'
      USER coder
  triggers:
    - type: ConfigChange
  runPolicy: Serial
EOF
```

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Specify the source image.
FROM docker.io/codercom/enterprise-base:ubuntu

# Switch to root
USER root

# As root:
# 1) Remove the original coder user with UID 1000
# 2) Add a coder group with an allowed UID
# 3) Add a coder user as a member of the above group
# 4) Fix ownership on the user's home directory
RUN userdel coder && \
    groupadd coder -g 1000680000 && \
    useradd -l -u 1000680000 coder -g 1000680000 && \
    chown -R coder:coder /home/coder

# Go back to the user 'coder'
USER coder
```

TITLE: Example Webhook Payload

```
{
    "_version": "1.0",
    "msg_id": "88750cad-77d4-4663-8bc0-f46855f5019b",
    "payload": {
        "_version": "1.0",
        "notification_name": "Workspace Deleted",
        "user_id": "4ac34fcb-8155-44d5-8301-e3cd46e88b35",
        "user_email": "danny@coder.com",
        "user_name": "danny",
        "user_username": "danny",
        "actions": [
            {
                "label": "View workspaces",
                "url": "https://et23ntkhpueak.pit-1.try.coder.app/workspaces"
            },
            {
                "label": "View templates",
                "url": "https://et23ntkhpueak.pit-1.try.coder.app/templates"
```

TITLE: Creating a Symlink and Tarring a Template
DESCRIPTION: This shell script creates a symbolic link to a local Terraform module directory within a Coder template directory, then archives the template using `tar`. This allows for including local modules in Coder templates. The archive is then pushed to Coder using the `coder templates` command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/faqs.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
ln -s modules template_1/modules
tar -cvh -C ./template_1 | coder templates <push|create> -d - <name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Kubernetes Secret Definition for Git Credentials
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows how to create a Kubernetes secret named `git-secrets` that contains the `.gitconfig` and `.git-credentials` files. The files are base64 encoded and stored as data within the secret. The namespace must be defined before applying the configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/modules.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: git-secrets
  namespace: $NAMESPACE
type: Opaque
data:
  .gitconfig: $(cat .gitconfig | base64 | tr -d '\n')
  .git-credentials: $(cat .git-credentials | base64 | tr -d '\n')
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Conditional Coder App Creation for Code-Server
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform code conditionally creates a `coder_app` resource for code-server based on the value of `data.coder_parameter.code_server.value`. If the parameter is `true`, the `coder_app` resource will be created; otherwise, it will not be created.  This uses the count meta-argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/faqs.md#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: Terraform
CODE:
```
# code-server
resource "coder_app" "code-server" {
count         = data.coder_parameter.code_server.value ? 1 : 0
agent_id      = coder_agent.coder.id
slug          = "code-server"
display_name  = "code-server"
icon          = "/icon/code.svg"
url           = "http://localhost:13337?folder=/home/coder"
subdomain = false
share     = "owner"

healthcheck {
    url       = "http://localhost:13337/healthz"
    interval  = 3
    threshold = 10
}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Caddyfile Configuration for Wildcard Certificates (Route53)
DESCRIPTION: This Caddyfile snippet configures Caddy to use AWS Route53 for DNS challenges when generating wildcard TLS certificates. It includes necessary credentials and settings for Route53, such as the AWS profile, access key ID, secret access key, token, and region.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/reverse-proxy-caddy.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: caddyfile
CODE:
```
tls {
-  on_demand
-  issuer acme {
-      email email@example.com
-  }

+  dns route53 {
+     max_retries 10
+     aws_profile "real-profile"
+     access_key_id "AKI..."
+     secret_access_key "wJa..."
+     token "TOKEN..."
+     region "us-east-1"
+  }
}
```

TITLE: Adding cgroup entries to cmdline.txt - text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the line that needs to be added to `/boot/firmware/cmdline.txt` or `/boot/cmdline.txt` to enable memory cgroup. It's crucial for resolving ContainerMemory query errors on Raspberry Pi OS and older Debian systems. It contains the parameters `cgroup_memory=1 cgroup_enable=memory`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/troubleshooting.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
cgroup_memory=1 cgroup_enable=memory
```

The request requires `Content-Type: application/json`, `Accept: application/json`, and `Coder-Session-Token` headers.

```
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Coder Helm Chart Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet provides a basic configuration example for the Coder Helm chart, setting environment variables like the Coder URL and Prometheus address. It also defines the replica count and secret names for the provisioner daemon.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/helm/provisioner/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  env:
    - name: CODER_URL
      value: "https://coder.example.com"
    # This env enables the Prometheus metrics endpoint.
    - name: CODER_PROMETHEUS_ADDRESS
      value: "0.0.0.0:2112"
  replicaCount: 10
provisionerDaemon:
  keySecretName: "coder-provisionerd-key"
  keySecretKey: "provisionerd-key"
```

TITLE: Executing Ping Command

SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/ping.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder ping [flags] <workspace>
```

TITLE: Unfavorite Workspace Usage - Coder CLI
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specified workspace from the user's list of favorite workspaces. The `<workspace>` argument refers to the name of the workspace to be unfavorited.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/unfavorite.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder unfavorite <workspace>
```

TITLE: Activating a User with Coder CLI

SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/users_activate.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder users activate [flags] <username|user_id>
```

```
coder users list [flags]
```

TITLE: Executing GET Request with Curl
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use curl to perform a GET request to retrieve workspace agent startup logs. It includes the endpoint URL with a placeholder for the workspace agent ID, as well as headers for accepting JSON and providing the Coder session token for authentication. This example provides a basic template for querying the API endpoint from a command line environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/agents.md#_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/workspaceagents/{workspaceagent}/startup-logs \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Initializing Coder templates
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to initialize Coder templates using the `coder-dev.sh` script. Running this command allows you to set up the basic structure for creating new workspace templates. The script prompts you to choose a template type, such as Develop in Docker, which generates a new folder containing the necessary files for the chosen template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/dogfood/coder/guide.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./scripts/coder-dev.sh templates init
```

DESCRIPTION: This command installs the NGINX web server on Debian/Ubuntu-based systems.  NGINX will act as a reverse proxy for the Coder deployment.

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo apt install nginx
```

TITLE: Product Information URL (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the productsInfoUrl, used by JetBrains Gateway to locate products.json.  This file, generated by the backend downloader, provides information about available products. The URL can be http://, https://, or file://.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/jetbrains/jetbrains-airgapped.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ cat productsInfoUrl # a path to products.json that was generated by the backend's downloader (it could be http://, https://, or file://)

https://internal.site/backends/<PRODUCT_CODE>/products.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Support Links in Kubernetes with YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures support links within a Coder Kubernetes deployment by updating the Helm chart values. It sets the `CODER_SUPPORT_LINKS` environment variable to a JSON array defining the names, targets, and icons for each support link. The support links will then appear in the user dropdown menu.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/setup/appearance.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
coder:
  env:
    - name: CODER_SUPPORT_LINKS
      value: >
        [{"name": "Hello GitHub", "target": "https://github.com/coder/coder",
        "icon": "bug"},
         {"name": "Hello Slack", "target":
        "https://codercom.slack.com/archives/C014JH42DBJ", "icon":
        "/icon/slack.svg"},
         {"name": "Hello Discord", "target": "https://discord.gg/coder", "icon":
        "/icon/discord.svg"},
         {"name": "Hello Foobar", "target": "https://foo.com/bar", "icon":
        "/emojis/1f3e1.png"}]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Canceling a Template Version with Curl
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to cancel a template version using a curl command. It requires the templateversion ID, a valid Accept header, and a Coder-Session-Token. Canceling halts any pending or ongoing operations related to the specified template version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/templates.md#_snippet_42

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X PATCH http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/templateversions/{templateversion}/cancel \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: SSH Configuration for JetBrains Gateway Connection
DESCRIPTION: This SSH configuration snippet adds a `ServerAliveInterval` setting to the SSH config file for JetBrains Gateway connections to Coder. This setting ensures that the SSH connection is checked periodically, preventing disconnects due to network changes. This setting prevents a hung session when a network disconnect occurs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/faqs.md#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
Host coder-jetbrains--*
  ServerAliveInterval 5
```

DESCRIPTION: This command is used to pull the Coder Docker image for version 2.7.1 from the GitHub Container Registry. It allows users to deploy or update their Coder instances using Docker. This command requires Docker to be installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/changelogs/v2.7.1.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:

```
docker pull ghcr.io/coder/coder:v2.7.1
```

TITLE: Deploying Multiple Provisioners - Coder Helm
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet configures the deployment of multiple provisioners in the same namespace, using `nameOverride` and `serviceAccount.name` to avoid conflicts.  It also shows how `nameOverride` does not apply to `extraTemplates`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/helm/provisioner/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  # ...
  serviceAccount:
    name: other-coder-provisioner
provisionerDaemon:
  # ...
nameOverride: "other-coder-provisioner"
extraTemplates:
	- |
		apiVersion: v1
		kind: ConfigMap
		metadata:
		  name: some-other-config
		  namespace: {{ .Release.Namespace }}
		data:
		  key: some-other-value
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/agents.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/workspaceagents/me/gitsshkey \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Create Kubernetes Secret for Database Connection URL
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a Kubernetes secret named 'coder-db-url' in the 'coder' namespace. This secret stores the PostgreSQL connection URL, which is essential for Coder to connect to the database. Ensure the URL is updated if a managed PostgreSQL is used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/rancher.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl create secret generic coder-db-url -n coder \
  --from-literal=url="postgres://coder:coder@coder-db-postgresql.coder.svc.cluster.local:5432/coder?sslmode=disable"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Response - Role Object - JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows the structure of a successful response (200 OK) after deleting an organization role. It includes the display name, name, organization ID, and permissions associated with the role. Permissions are defined at the organization, site, and user levels and may include negation.

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```

  {
    "display_name": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "organization_id": "7c60d51f-b44e-4682-87d6-449835ea4de6",
    "organization_permissions": [
      {
        "action": "application_connect",
        "negate": true,
        "resource_type": "*"
      }
    ],
    "site_permissions": [
      {
        "action": "application_connect",
        "negate": true,
```

TITLE: Enabling Path-Based App Sharing in Kubernetes

TITLE: Setting Remote Path for LSP Servers
DESCRIPTION: This Emacs Lisp snippet adds a directory to the `tramp-remote-path` when connecting to a specific machine via TRAMP. This allows `lsp-mode` to find LSP server binaries that are not in the default path. A connection profile named 'remote-path-lsp-servers' is created, setting `tramp-remote-path` to include the specified `<PATH TO ADD>`. This profile is then associated with connections to `coder.<WORKSPACE NAME>`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/emacs-tramp.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Lisp
CODE:
```
(connection-local-set-profile-variables 'remote-path-lsp-servers
                                 '((tramp-remote-path . ("<PATH TO ADD>" tramp-default-remote-path))))
(connection-local-set-profiles '(:machine "coder.<WORKSPACE NAME>") 'remote-path-lsp-servers)
```

TITLE: Define volume and volumeMounts in Helm chart (client)
DESCRIPTION: Defines a volume and volumeMounts in the Coder Helm chart to mount the PostgreSQL client certificate secret to the `$HOME/.postgresql` directory within the Coder workspace.  This allows Coder to access the client certificate for SSL connection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/postgres-ssl.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  volumes:
    - name: "pg-certs-mount"
      secret:
        secretName: "postgres-certs"
  volumeMounts:
    - name: "pg-certs-mount"
      mountPath: "$HOME/.postgresql"
      readOnly: true
```

TITLE: Starting Azure VM with Azure CLI in Terraform
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform snippet defines a `null_resource` that starts an Azure VM when the Coder workspace transitions to the 'start' state. It uses the `az vm start` command to start the VM.  It depends on the `azurerm_windows_virtual_machine.main` resource.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/examples/templates/azure-windows/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "null_resource" "start" {
  count      = data.coder_workspace.me.transition == "start" ? 1 : 0
  depends_on = [azurerm_windows_virtual_machine.main]
  provisioner "local-exec" {
    command = "az vm start --ids ${azurerm_windows_virtual_machine.main.id}"
  }
}
```

TITLE: Publishing Coder Modules to Artifactory via Shell Script
DESCRIPTION: This shell script demonstrates how to publish Coder modules to Artifactory. It involves cloning the `coder/modules` repository, navigating into the `modules` directory, configuring the JFrog CLI with `jf tfc`, and then publishing the module using `jf tf p`.  It assumes JFrog CLI is already configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/modules.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/coder/modules
cd modules
jf tfc
jf tf p --namespace="coder" --provider="coder" --tag="1.0.0"
```

TITLE: Update Active Template Version with PATCH (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to update the active version of a template using a PATCH request with curl. It includes setting the content type, accepting JSON responses, and passing the Coder session token for authentication. Replace `API_KEY` with your actual API key.

LANGUAGE: shell

```
curl -X PATCH http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/templates/{template}/versions \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Building Frontend Assets for E2E Tests (pnpm)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to build the frontend assets required for end-to-end tests using pnpm. The `pnpm build` command builds the assets. Adding `--watch` allows for automatic rebuilding when changes are detected.  Alternatively, building with debug info and source maps can be achieved using `NODE_ENV=development pnpm vite build --mode=development`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/site/e2e/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd site
# Build the frontend assets. If you are actively changing
# the site to debug an issue, add `--watch`.
pnpm build
# Alternatively, build with debug info and source maps:
NODE_ENV=development pnpm vite build --mode=development
```

TITLE: Configure Docker Container to Block File Transfers (Terraform)
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform snippet configures a Docker container within a Coder workspace to block file transfers. It sets the `CODER_AGENT_BLOCK_FILE_TRANSFER` environment variable to `true`, which instructs the Coder agent to block applications like `scp`, `rsync`, `ftp`, and `nc` from transferring files. The `CODER_AGENT_TOKEN` is also included for proper agent authentication and operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/faqs.md#_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: tf
CODE:
```
resource "docker_container" "workspace" {
  ...
  env = [
    "CODER_AGENT_TOKEN=${coder_agent.main.token}",
    "CODER_AGENT_BLOCK_FILE_TRANSFER=true",
    ...
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Fetching data with axios - Typescript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example of fetching data using axios in a TypeScript environment. The function `getAgentListeningPorts` takes an agentID as input and makes a GET request to the specified endpoint. It then returns a Promise that resolves to a `ListeningPortsResponse` type defined in `TypesGen`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/contributing/frontend.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ts
CODE:
```
export const getAgentListeningPorts = async (
    agentID: string,
): Promise<TypesGen.ListeningPortsResponse> => {
    const response = await axiosInstance.get(
        `/api/v2/workspaceagents/${agentID}/listening-ports`,
    );
    return response.data;
};
```

TITLE: JSON Schema for Teams Notification Payload
DESCRIPTION: This JSON schema is used to parse the notification payload received from Coder in a Microsoft Teams workflow. It defines the structure of the JSON object, including properties for the version, user email, actions, title, and body. This schema is used in the 'Parse JSON' action within the Teams workflow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/monitoring/notifications/teams.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "_version": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "payload": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
                "_version": {
                    "type": "string"
                },
                "user_email": {
                    "type": "string"
                },
                "actions": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "properties": {
                            "label": {
                                "type": "string"
                            },
                            "url": {
                                "type": "string"
                            }
                        },
                        "required": ["label", "url"]
                    }
                }
            }
        },
        "title_markdown": {
            "type": "string"
        },
        "body_markdown": {
            "type": "string"
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Coder Provisioner Helm Values Configuration (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration file (`provisioner-values.yaml`) defines the settings for deploying Coder provisioner daemons using Helm. It specifies the Coder URL, replica count, and authentication using a provisioner key stored in a Kubernetes secret.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/provisioners/index.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  env:
    - name: CODER_URL
      value: "https://coder.example.com"
  replicaCount: 10
provisionerDaemon:
  # NOTE: in older versions of the Helm chart (2.17.0 and below), it is required to set this to an empty string.
  pskSecretName: ""
  keySecretName: "coder-provisioner-keys"
  keySecretKey: "my-cool-key"
```

TITLE: Generating Client Certificate with OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a private key and a self-signed certificate using OpenSSL. The certificate is valid for 730 days and includes subject information such as the organization and location.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/azure-federation.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
openssl req -subj '/CN=myclientcertificate/O=MyCompany, Inc./ST=CA/C=US' \
  -new -newkey rsa:4096 -sha256 -days 730 -nodes -x509 -keyout client.key -out client.crt
```

```
})
```

TITLE: Create Docker Volume for Persistent Home Directory
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Docker volume resource for the workspace's home directory, ensuring it persists after the workspace is stopped. It uses the lifecycle block to prevent accidental deletions and an immutable parameter to prevent destruction on workspace name changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/template-from-scratch.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: tf
CODE:
```
resource "docker_volume" "home_volume" {
  name = "coder-${data.coder_workspace.me.id}-home"
  # Protect the volume from being deleted due to changes in attributes.
  lifecycle {
    ignore_changes = all
  }
}
```

TITLE: Listing Kubernetes Contexts
DESCRIPTION: This command lists the available Kubernetes contexts in your kubeconfig file.  It's used to verify the available cluster configurations before configuring Coder. No dependencies are required other than kubectl being installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/integrations/multiple-kube-clusters.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl config get-contexts

CURRENT   NAME                        CLUSTER
          workspaces-europe-west2-c   workspaces-europe-west2-c
*         workspaces-us-central1-a    workspaces-us-central1-a
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Outputting PostgreSQL Connection URL
DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves and displays the PostgreSQL connection URL when using the built-in PostgreSQL deployment. The output can be used with `psql` to access the database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/setup/index.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ coder server postgres-builtin-url
psql "postgres://coder@localhost:49627/coder?sslmode=disable&password=feU...yI1"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing Coder settings/cache - Linux
DESCRIPTION: This command removes the Coder settings and cache directories in the user's home directory on Linux systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/uninstall.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
rm -rf ~/.config/coderv2
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
rm -rf ~/.cache/coder
```

```
dns_cloudflare_api_token = YOUR_API_TOKEN
```

TITLE: Request OAuth2 Authorization with curl
DESCRIPTION: Requests OAuth2 authorization using a POST request to the `/oauth2/authorize` endpoint. Requires parameters like `client_id`, `state`, and `response_type`. Returns a 302 Found status, redirecting the user after authorization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X POST http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/oauth2/authorize?client_id=string&state=string&response_type=code \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Display Memory Usage Statistics
DESCRIPTION: This command displays memory usage statistics. It supports flags to force host memory measurement (--host), specify the SI prefix for memory measurement (--prefix), and control the output format (--output). The default output format is text, and the default prefix is Gi (gigabytes).
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/stat_mem.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder stat mem [flags]
```

TITLE: Creating Kubernetes Secret for GCP Identity Token
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Kubernetes secret to store the Google Cloud service account identity token.  The secret is named `gcp-identity-token` and resides in the `coder` namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/gcp-to-aws.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
kubectl create secret generic gcp-identity-token -n coder --from-literal=token=<enter-token-here>
```

TITLE: Enabling Docker Verbose Logging
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides instructions for enabling verbose logging in Docker by modifying the `daemon.json` file. This involves copying the original file, adding debug settings, and restarting the Docker service. This increased logging helps in troubleshooting container issues by providing more detailed information in the journald logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/dogfood/coder/guide.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo cp /etc/docker/daemon.json /etc/docker/daemon.json.orig
sudo cat > /etc/docker/daemon.json << EOF
{
        "debug": true,
        "log-driver": "journald"
}
EOF
sudo systemctl restart docker
# You should now see container logs in journald.
# Try starting a workspace again and see what the actual error is!
sudo journalctl -u docker -f
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Playwright E2E Tests (pnpm)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to run the Playwright end-to-end tests using pnpm. The `pnpm playwright:test` command executes all the tests defined in the project.  To run a specific test, use `pnpm playwright:test -g '<your test here>'`, where `-g` (grep) accepts a regex to filter the tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/site/e2e/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Run E2E tests. You can see the configuration of the server
# in `playwright.config.ts`. This uses `go run -tags embed ...`.
pnpm playwright:test
# Run a specific test (`-g` stands for grep. It accepts regex).
pnpm playwright:test -g '<your test here>'
```

TITLE: Extending workspace deadline using Coder REST API
DESCRIPTION: This script demonstrates how to keep a workspace active by extending its deadline using the Coder REST API. It sends a PUT request to the /extend endpoint with a new deadline. The script checks if a specific process is running and extends the deadline only if it is.  It requires the WORKSPACE_ID and CODER_AGENT_TOKEN environment variables to be set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/index.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
#!/bin/bash
# Send workspace activity as long as the job is still running

while true
do
  if pgrep -f "my_training_script.py" > /dev/null
  then
    curl -X PUT "https://coder.example.com/api/v2/workspaces/$WORKSPACE_ID/extend" \
    -H "Coder-Session-Token: $CODER_AGENT_TOKEN" \
    -d '{
      "deadline": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z"
    }'

    # Sleep for 30 minutes (1800 seconds) if the job is running
    sleep 1800
  else
    # Sleep for 1 minute (60 seconds) if the job is not running
    sleep 60
  fi
done
```

TITLE: Coder Agent for RStudio (Startup Script)
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform resource configures a Coder agent to run RStudio. The startup script starts the RStudio server in daemon mode with authentication disabled. The directory is set to /home/coder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/web-ides.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: terraform
CODE:
```
resource "coder_agent" "coder" {
  os             = "linux"
  arch           = "amd64"
  dir            = "/home/coder"
  startup_script = <<EOT
#!/bin/bash
# start rstudio
/usr/lib/rstudio-server/bin/rserver --server-daemonize=1 --auth-none=1 &
EOT
}
```

TITLE: Conditional Code-Server Installation in Startup Script

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
# install and start code-server, VS Code in a browser

if [ ${data.coder_parameter.code_server.value} = true ]; then
echo " Downloading and installing the latest code-server IDE..."
curl -fsSL https://code-server.dev/install.sh | sh
code-server --auth none --port 13337 >/dev/null 2>&1 &
fi
```

TITLE: Import Certificate to Java Trust Store (Windows)


TITLE: Get Available IdP Sync Claim Fields with curl

It sends a GET request to the specified endpoint with the appropriate headers for accepting JSON responses and providing the Coder session token for authentication.  The expected response is a JSON array of strings representing the available claim fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_92

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/settings/idpsync/available-fields \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rotating Encryption Keys (Kubernetes Secret)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates how to update the Kubernetes secret with multiple encryption keys during key rotation. The newest key should be listed first, followed by older keys. This allows Coder to decrypt data encrypted with older keys while encrypting new data with the new key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/security/database-encryption.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
type: Opaque
metadata:
  name: coder-external-token-encryption-keys
  namespace: coder-namespace
data:
  keys: <new-key>,<old-key1>,<old-key2>,...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Update Role IdP Sync Mapping with PATCH (curl)
DESCRIPTION: Updates Role IdP (Identity Provider) synchronization mappings using a PATCH request. Requires the organization ID and a valid Coder session token. The request body specifies mappings to add and remove.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_74

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X PATCH http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/organizations/{organization}/settings/idpsync/roles/mapping \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

DESCRIPTION: This is an example JSON response returned after successfully creating a new session key. The response contains a single field, `key`, which holds the newly generated API key as a string. This key should be securely stored and used for subsequent authenticated requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/users.md#_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "key": "string"
}
```

TITLE: Pushing Template Example (Coder Dev Script)
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to update and push a template to Coder using the `coder-dev.sh` script.  It specifies the template name, the directory containing the template files, and uses the `-y` flag to bypass confirmation prompts. It assumes the script `coder-dev.sh` is available in the `./scripts` directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/examples/workspace-tags/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./scripts/coder-dev.sh templates push examples-workspace-tags \
  -d examples/workspace-tags \
  -y
```

It is an array of objects, where each object represents a build parameter and has `name` and `value` properties, both of which are strings. These parameters can be used to configure the workspace build process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/builds.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  {
    "name": "string",
    "value": "string"
  }
]
```

TITLE: Example Create User Request Body
DESCRIPTION: This is an example JSON payload for creating a new user. It includes required fields such as `email`, `login_type`, `name`, `organization_ids`, `password`, `user_status`, and `username`. The server expects this data in the request body when creating a new user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/users.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "login_type": "",
  "name": "string",
  "organization_ids": [
    "497f6eca-6276-4993-bfeb-53cbbbba6f08"
  ],
  "password": "string",
  "user_status": "active",
  "username": "string"
}
```

TITLE: Defining a Required Parameter in Terraform
DESCRIPTION: This code defines a `coder_parameter` resource named `account_name` without a `default` property. This makes the parameter required, meaning the user must provide a value for it when creating a workspace. The `mutable` attribute is set to `true`, allowing the user to modify the value after creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/parameters.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Terraform
CODE:
```
data "coder_parameter" "account_name" {
  name        = "Account name"
  description = "Cloud account name"
  mutable     = true
}
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Cleaning up Workspaces with Coder CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command cleans up workspaces created with the scaletest utility. It deletes all workspaces and users with the prefix `scaletest-`. The `coder exp scaletest cleanup` command is used with options to specify cleanup job timeout and cleanup timeout.  This assumes that the workspaces were created using the scaletest utility and are prefixed with 'scaletest-'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/infrastructure/scale-utility.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
coder exp scaletest cleanup \
    --cleanup-job-timeout 2h \
    --cleanup-timeout 15min
```

TITLE: Creating Organization Roles from JSON Input
DESCRIPTION: This command allows creating an organization role by reading the role definition from a JSON file provided via stdin. The `-O <organization_name>` flag specifies the target organization. The `--stdin` flag indicates that the input should be read from stdin. This method enables the creation of complex roles with detailed configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/organizations_roles_create.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder organization -O <organization_name> roles create --stidin < role.json
```

TITLE: Validating Kernel Configuration
DESCRIPTION: These commands validate that the required kernel config `CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO_BTF=y` is enabled. The config must be enabled for the workspace process logging feature to work.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/process-logging.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cat /proc/config.gz | gunzip | grep CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO_BTF
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cat "/boot/config-$(uname -r)" | grep CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO_BTF
```

TITLE: Deleting a User Group - coder groups delete
DESCRIPTION: Deletes a user group specified by name using the `coder groups delete` command. The command also provides an alias `rm`. The `-O` or `--org` flag allows specifying the organization (UUID or name) in which the group should be deleted. The organization can also be set using the `$CODER_ORGANIZATION` environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/groups_delete.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder groups delete [flags] <name>
```

TITLE: Assigning Role to Organization Member with Curl
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to assign a role to an organization member using a curl command. It sends a PUT request to the specified endpoint with the role to assign in the request body, including the necessary authentication and content type headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/members.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X PUT http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/organizations/{organization}/members/{user}/roles \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Running an external provisioner via Docker (sh)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to run a Coder provisioner within a Docker container. It uses the `docker run` command with environment variables for the Coder URL and session token.  It executes the `/opt/coder provisioner start` command within the Coder Docker image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/provisioners/index.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -it \
  -e CODER_URL=https://coder.example.com/ \
  -e CODER_SESSION_TOKEN=your_token \
  --entrypoint /opt/coder \
  ghcr.io/coder/coder:latest \
  provisioner start
```

TITLE: Archive Template Versions (Coder CLI)
DESCRIPTION: This command archives one or more template versions within the Coder environment. It requires the template name and optionally accepts a list of template version names to archive. The `-y` or `--yes` flag bypasses prompts, and the `-O` or `--org` flag specifies the organization to use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/templates_versions_archive.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder templates versions archive [flags] <template-name> [template-version-names...] 
```

TITLE: Update Group IDP Sync Mapping
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates updating group IDP sync mapping using a PATCH request. The request requires the organization ID, authentication token, and a JSON body with mappings to add or remove.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_66

LANGUAGE: shell

TITLE: Configuring Ansi Term Directory Tracking
DESCRIPTION: This bash script configures the shell to announce the hostname, user, and working directory to Emacs via escape codes. This enables directory tracking in Emacs's ansi-term mode, allowing Emacs to automatically update its `default-directory` when the shell's working directory changes.  It overrides the `cd`, `pushd`, and `popd` commands to ensure the escape codes are sent after each directory change.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/emacs-tramp.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
ansi_term_announce_host() {
    printf '\033AnSiTh %s\n' "coder.$CODER_WORKSPACE_NAME"
}

ansi_term_announce_user() {
    printf '\033AnSiTu %s\n' "$USER"
}

ansi_term_announce_pwd() {
    printf '\033AnSiTc %s\n' "$PWD"
}

ansi_term_announce() {
    ansi_term_announce_host
    ansi_term_announce_user
    ansi_term_announce_pwd
}

cd()    { command cd    "$@"; ansi_term_announce_pwd; }
pushd() { command pushd "$@"; ansi_term_announce_pwd; }
popd()  { command popd  "$@"; ansi_term_announce_pwd; }

ansi_term_announce
```

```
CODER_OAUTH2_GITHUB_ALLOW_SIGNUPS=true
CODER_OAUTH2_GITHUB_ALLOWED_ORGS="your-org"
CODER_OAUTH2_GITHUB_CLIENT_ID="8d1...e05"
CODER_OAUTH2_GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET="57ebc9...02c24c"
```

TITLE: Creating a user group with coder groups create
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a user group using the Coder CLI.  It takes the group's name as an argument and supports flags to set the avatar URL, display name, and organization. The command requires the Coder CLI to be installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/groups_create.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder groups create [flags] <name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Check Authorization via API - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell script demonstrates how to check user authorization using the `/authcheck` endpoint. It requires a Coder session token for authentication and sends a JSON payload containing authorization checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/authorization.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X POST http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/authcheck \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Get Role IDP Sync Settings
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates retrieving role IDP sync settings for an organization using a GET request. It requires the organization ID as a parameter and includes the necessary headers for authentication and content type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_69

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/organizations/{organization}/settings/idpsync/roles \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticate with Coder
DESCRIPTION: This command logs you into your Coder deployment using the Coder CLI. It requires that you have the Coder CLI installed and configured to connect to your Coder instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/creating-templates.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder login
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Schemas using psql
DESCRIPTION: This shell command executes a psql command to list all schemas. It is used to verify if the desired schema exists and if the user has permissions to access it. It is used for troubleshooting purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/external-database.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
psql -U coder -c '\dn'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initialize Coder Template
DESCRIPTION: This command initializes a Coder template from the default "Kubernetes" template, creating a new directory named `openshift-k8s` in the current directory. It uses the `coderv2` CLI tool. Assumes the coder cli tool is installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/openshift.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
echo kubernetes | coderv2 templates init ./openshift-k8s
cd ./openshift-k8s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading JetBrains Client Downloader - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and extracts the JetBrains Client Downloader binary for Linux.  Removes the downloaded archive after extraction. Requires `wget` and `tar` utilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/jetbrains/jetbrains-pre-install.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
wget https://download.jetbrains.com/idea/code-with-me/backend/jetbrains-clients-downloader-linux-x86_64-1867.tar.gz && \
tar -xzvf jetbrains-clients-downloader-linux-x86_64-1867.tar.gz
rm jetbrains-clients-downloader-linux-x86_64-1867.tar.gz
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring TLS Client Certificates via Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: These environment variables configure Coder to use client TLS certificates for authentication with the OpenID Connect provider. `CODER_TLS_CLIENT_CERT_FILE` specifies the path to the certificate file, and `CODER_TLS_CLIENT_KEY_FILE` specifies the path to the key file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/users/oidc-auth.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
CODER_TLS_CLIENT_CERT_FILE=/path/to/cert.pem
CODER_TLS_CLIENT_KEY_FILE=/path/to/key.pem
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Google Service Account Identity Token
DESCRIPTION: Generates a JWT identity token for a Google Cloud service account, intended for use with AWS. Requires the `gcloud` CLI. The token includes the service account email and specifies the AWS audience.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/gcp-to-aws.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
gcloud auth print-identity-token --audiences=https://aws.amazon.com --impersonate-service-account 12345-compute@developer.gserviceaccount.com  --include-email
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating PKCS bundle with OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: This command generates a .pfx file (PKCS#12 format) from the private key and certificate, which will be used by Coder's Provisioner to authenticate with Azure. A password is set for the bundle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/azure-federation.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
openssl pkcs12 -export -password pass:"Pa55w0rd123" -out client.pfx -inkey client.key -in client.crt
```

TITLE: Get SCIM Users with curl
DESCRIPTION: This curl command retrieves a list of SCIM users. It sends a GET request to the specified endpoint and includes an authorization header.  It depends on a valid API key for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_81

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/scim/v2/Users \
  -H 'Authorizaiton: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Installing netcat using apt-get in Debian/Ubuntu
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install netcat using the apt package manager on Debian or Ubuntu-based systems. Netcat is a utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP. It's used to diagnose network connectivity issues and perform other network-related tasks. It requires root privileges to install packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/dogfood/coder/guide.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo apt update
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo apt install -y netcat
```

TITLE: Get User Roles with curl
DESCRIPTION: This shell command shows how to retrieve a user's roles using curl. It sends a GET request to the specified endpoint, including the Coder-Session-Token for authentication. The expected response is a JSON object containing the user's information and roles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/users.md#_snippet_54

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/users/{user}/roles \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering LSP Client for Remote Use
DESCRIPTION: This Emacs Lisp snippet registers an LSP client for use with a language server running on a remote machine accessed via TRAMP. It defines how to connect to the LSP server binary, the Emacs major mode for which the server should be used, and a unique server ID. This configures lsp-mode to find and use the specified language server within the Coder workspace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/emacs-tramp.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Lisp
CODE:
```
(lsp-register-client (make-lsp-client :new-connection (lsp-tramp-connection "<LSP SERVER BINARY>")
              :major-modes '(<LANGUAGE MODE>)
              :remote? t
              :server-id '<LANGUAGE SERVER ID>))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Get User Latency Insights with cURL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve insights about user latency using a cURL request. It requires `start_time` and `end_time` parameters. A valid Coder API key is required for authentication.  The API returns a JSON response containing a report with user latency data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/insights.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/insights/user-latency?start_time=2019-08-24T14%3A15%3A22Z&end_time=2019-08-24T14%3A15%3A22Z \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: Creating a Coder workspace
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a new Coder workspace using the `coder-dev.sh` script.  It takes the workspace name and a template name as arguments. The template argument specifies the base image or configuration to use for the new workspace. This command assumes that the `coder-dev.sh` script is executable and accessible in the current directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/dogfood/coder/guide.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./scripts/coder-dev.sh create myworkspace -t docker-amd64
```

TITLE: Setting the CODER_E2E_LICENSE environment variable
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the `CODER_E2E_LICENSE` environment variable, which is required to run enterprise tests. Replace `<license key>` with the actual license key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/site/e2e/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export CODER_E2E_LICENSE=<license key>
```

TITLE: Creating Let's Encrypt Wildcard Certificate
DESCRIPTION: This command uses Certbot to create a Let's Encrypt wildcard certificate for the Coder subdomain.  It uses the Cloudflare DNS plugin and the API token to complete the DNS challenge.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/reverse-proxy-nginx.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo certbot certonly --dns-cloudflare --dns-cloudflare-credentials ~/.secrets/certbot/cloudflare.ini -d coder.example.com -d *.coder.example.com
```

TITLE: Executing dbcrypt command
DESCRIPTION: This command is used to manage database encryption within the Coder server. It serves as the entry point for various subcommands related to encryption management. No specific dependencies are listed, but access to the Coder server CLI is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/server_dbcrypt.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder server dbcrypt
```

TITLE: Showing a User with Coder CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command shows information about a specified user.  The user can be identified by username, user ID, or using 'me' to represent the currently authenticated user. The output format can be specified via the `--output` flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/users_show.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder users show [flags] <username|user_id|'me'>
```

TITLE: Caddyfile Configuration for Wildcard Certificates (CloudFlare)
DESCRIPTION: This Caddyfile snippet configures Caddy to use CloudFlare for DNS challenges when generating wildcard TLS certificates.  It uses a Cloudflare API token with zone edit permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/reverse-proxy-caddy.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: caddyfile
CODE:
```
tls {
-  on_demand
-  issuer acme {
-      email email@example.com
-  }

+  dns cloudflare CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN
}
```

TITLE: Removing obsolete coder provider block
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the removal of the `feature_use_managed_variables` attribute from the Coder provider block in Terraform templates. This attribute is no longer required as managed variables are enabled by default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/changelogs/v0.26.0.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
provider "coder" {
-  feature_use_managed_variables = "true"
}
```

TITLE: Example Successful Sync Logs
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides an example of successful sync logs from the Coder server. These logs show successful retrieval of OIDC claims and group information, which is essential for successful group/role/organization sync.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/users/idp-sync.md#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
[debu]  coderd.userauth: got oidc claims  request_id=49e86507-6842-4b0b-94d4-f245e62e49f3  source=id_token  claim_fields="[aio aud email exp groups iat idp iss name nbf oid preferred_username rh sub tid uti ver]"  blank=[]

[debu]  coderd.userauth: got oidc claims  request_id=49e86507-6842-4b0b-94d4-f245e62e49f3  source=userinfo  claim_fields="[email family_name given_name name picture sub]"  blank=[]

[debu]  coderd.userauth: got oidc claims  request_id=49e86507-6842-4b0b-94d4-f245e62e49f3  source=merged  claim_fields="[aio aud email exp family_name given_name groups iat idp iss name nbf oid picture preferred_username rh sub tid uti ver]"  blank=[]

[debu]  coderd: groups returned in oidc claims  request_id=49e86507-6842-4b0b-94d4-f245e62e49f3  email=ben@coder.com  username=ben  len=3  groups="[c8048e91-f5c3-47e5-9693-834de84034ad 66ad2cc3-a42f-4574-a281-40d1922e5b65 70b48175-107b-4ad8-b405-4d888a1c466f]"
```

TITLE: Configure Coder Service and Cache
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Coder service, connection URLs, and cache directory using environment variables and volumes. It sets the service type to `ClusterIP`, defines environment variables for PostgreSQL connection, access URL, and cache directory, and mounts a temporary volume for the cache.  The `CODER_CACHE_DIRECTORY` is mapped to `/tmp/coder` to address read-only filesystem constraints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/openshift.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  service:
    type: ClusterIP
  env:
    - name: CODER_CACHE_DIRECTORY
      value: /tmp/coder
    - name: CODER_PG_CONNECTION_URL
      valueFrom:
        secretKeyRef:
          key: url
          name: coder-db-url
    - name: CODER_ACCESS_URL
      value: "https://coder-example.apps.openshiftapps.com"
  securityContext:
    runAsNonRoot: true
    runAsUser: <project-specific UID>
    runAsGroup: <project-specific GID>
    readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
  volumes:
    - name: "cache"
      emptyDir:
        sizeLimit: 1Gi
  volumeMounts:
    - name: "cache"
      mountPath: "/tmp"
      readOnly: false
```

TITLE: Hide Resource in Coder Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration demonstrates how to hide a resource in the Coder dashboard UI.  It uses the `coder_metadata` resource with the `hide = true` attribute to prevent the `kubernetes_service_account` from being displayed, keeping the workspace view clean. The `count` attribute ensures the resource is only present when the workspace is active.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/resource-metadata.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Terraform
CODE:
```
resource "coder_metadata" "hide_serviceaccount" {
  count = data.coder_workspace.me.start_count
  resource_id = kubernetes_service_account.user_data.id
  hide = true
  item {
    key = "name"
    value = kubernetes_deployment.coder[0].metadata[0].name
  }
}
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/general.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
  "example"
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: JRE Download URL (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the jreDownloadUrl, which points to the JBR (JetBrains Runtime) files for the JetBrains IDE.  This URL is used by JetBrains Gateway to download the correct JRE. The URL can be http://, https://, or file://.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/jetbrains/jetbrains-airgapped.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ cat jreDownloadUrl # a path for JBR that you got from the clients' downloader (it could be http://, https://, or file://)

https://internal.site/jre/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Coder Public Key
DESCRIPTION: This command displays the user's Coder public key used for Git operations. It is invoked via the command line using 'coder publickey'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/publickey.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder publickey [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Login User - JSON Body
DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload contains the user's email and password for authentication via the `/users/login` endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/authorization.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "string"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing Terraform Module from GitHub
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform code demonstrates how to reference a Terraform module from a GitHub repository within a Coder template. It allows for code reuse and customization by passing template-specific parameters. It also includes a template-specific resource for each template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/faqs.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Terraform
CODE:
```
# template1/main.tf
module "central-coder-module" {
  source = "github.com/org/central-coder-module"
  myparam = "custom-for-template1"
}

resource "ebs_volume" "custom_template1_only_resource" {
}

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Dotfiles Command
DESCRIPTION: Executes the coder dotfiles command with specified flags and a Git repository URL. The git_repo_url argument is required and specifies the location of the dotfiles repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/dotfiles.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
coder dotfiles [flags] <git_repo_url>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Allowing Everyone to Sign Up Using GitHub via Env Variable
DESCRIPTION: This environment variable allows anyone with a GitHub account to sign up for Coder. Setting this variable to `true` removes the restriction to specific organizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/users/github-auth.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
CODER_OAUTH2_GITHUB_ALLOW_EVERYONE=true
```

TITLE: Patch Template Version Request Body (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows the expected structure for the request body when patching a template version. It includes fields such as "message" and "name". These fields are used to update the corresponding template version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/templates.md#_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "message": "string",
  "name": "string"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Coder Helm Chart (Stable)
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the stable version of the Coder Helm chart.  It uses the `helm install` command, specifying the release name (`coder`), chart location (`coder-v2/coder`), namespace (`coder`), values file (`values.yaml`), and version (`2.9.1`). Ensure Helm is installed and configured to connect to your Kubernetes cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/scripts/release/testdata/autoversion/docs/kubernetes.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
helm install coder coder-v2/coder \
    --namespace coder \
    --values values.yaml \
    --version 2.9.1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Organization Member with Curl
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add a user as a member to an organization using a curl command. It sends a POST request to the specified endpoint with the required headers for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/members.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X POST http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/organizations/{organization}/members/{user} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Update Health Settings with Curl
DESCRIPTION: This shell snippet demonstrates how to use curl to make a PUT request to the `/debug/health/settings` endpoint. It includes setting the `Content-Type` and `Accept` headers to `application/json`, and uses the `Coder-Session-Token` header for authentication.  The example shows how to send a request to update health settings using the command line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/debug.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X PUT http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/debug/health/settings \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Coder Template to Instance
DESCRIPTION: This shell command pushes the Coder template to the running Coder instance.  It assumes you are in the correct directory where the template was created (e.g., `./azure-linux`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/cloud/azure-vm.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
coder templates push
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "callback_url": "string",
  "icon": "string",
  "name": "string"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resume Coder Notifications
DESCRIPTION: This command allows administrators to resume Coder notifications after they have been paused. It re-enables the dispatching of messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/cli/notifications.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
$ coder notifications resume
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Import Certificate to Java Trust Store (Linux)
DESCRIPTION: Imports a given certificate to the Java trust store of a JetBrains Gateway installation in Linux. This is used to establish a secure connection to Coder deployments utilizing internally signed certificates. It requires the `keytool` utility which comes with Java.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/user-guides/workspace-access/jetbrains/index.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
keytool -import -alias coder -file <certificate> -keystore /path/to/trust/store
```

TITLE: Custom DERP Relay Configuration (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration defines a custom DERP relay server for Coder. It specifies the region ID, code, name, and node details, including the hostname. This configuration is used when you want lower latency than what Tailscale offers or need additional DERP relays for offline deployments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/networking/index.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "Regions": {
    "1": {
      "RegionID": 1,
      "RegionCode": "myderp",
      "RegionName": "My DERP",
      "Nodes": [
        {
          "Name": "1",
          "RegionID": 1,
          "HostName": "your-hostname.com"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing TLS Secret in Coder Helm Chart Values
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reference the TLS secret created in Kubernetes within the Coder Helm chart values. It also shows how to configure the Ingress controller if it is used to terminate TLS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/setup/index.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
coder:
  tls:
    secretName:
      - coder-tls

  # Alternatively, if you use an Ingress controller to terminate TLS,
  # set the following values:
  ingress:
    enable: true
    secretName: coder-tls
    wildcardSecretName: coder-tls
```

TITLE: Get Resources (curl)
DESCRIPTION: This curl command retrieves resources for a template version dry-run job.  It requires the template version ID and job ID. The command includes headers for accepting JSON and providing the Coder session token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/templates.md#_snippet_55

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -X GET http://coder-server:8080/api/v2/templateversions/{templateversion}/dry-run/{jobID}/resources \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Coder-Session-Token: API_KEY'
```

TITLE: CloudWatch Log Insights Query
DESCRIPTION: This is an example query to be run in AWS CloudWatch Log Insights to view workspace process logs. It filters the logs by container name, username, and workspace name and displays the timestamp and command line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/process-logging.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
fields @timestamp, log_processed.fields.cmdline
| sort @timestamp asc
| filter kubernetes.container_name="exectrace"
| filter log_processed.fields.labels.username="zac"
| filter log_processed.fields.labels.workspace_name="code"
```

TITLE: Delete OAuth2 Application using curl
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to delete an existing OAuth2 application using a `curl` command. It sends a DELETE request to the `/oauth2-provider/apps/{app}` endpoint, where `{app}` should be replaced with the application ID. The request requires authentication via the `Coder-Session-Token` header.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/reference/api/enterprise.md#_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:

TITLE: Defining Coder App for Airflow
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform resource defines a Coder application for Airflow. It specifies the agent ID, slug, display name, URL, and icon. Subdomain is set to true. The share is set to owner. It also includes a healthcheck configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/extending-templates/web-ides.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: terraform
CODE:
```
resource "coder_app" "airflow" {
  agent_id      = coder_agent.coder.id
  slug          = "airflow"
  display_name  = "Airflow"
  icon          = "/icon/airflow.svg"
  url           = "http://localhost:8080"
  subdomain     = true
  share         = "owner"

  healthcheck {
    url       = "http://localhost:8080/healthz"
    interval  = 10
    threshold = 60
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Coder App for Code-Server
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Coder app resource for code-server, allowing developers to access it from the workspace's Coder dashboard. It defines the URL, icon, and healthcheck for the app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/tutorials/template-from-scratch.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: tf
CODE:
```
resource "coder_app" "code-server" {
  agent_id     = coder_agent.main.id
  slug         = "code-server"
  display_name = "code-server"
  url          = "http://localhost:13337/?folder=/home/${local.username}"
  icon         = "/icon/code.svg"
  subdomain    = false
  share        = "owner"

  healthcheck {
    url       = "http://localhost:13337/healthz"
    interval  = 5
    threshold = 6
  }
}
```

TITLE: Creating Workspaces with Coder CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a number of Coder workspaces using the specified template and extra parameters. It uses the `coder exp scaletest create-workspaces` command with options for retries, workspace count, template selection, concurrency, timeouts, cleanup, and output formatting.  The environment variables control the number of workspaces created, the template used for workspace creation, the concurrency level for workspace creation, and the directory where the results are stored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/infrastructure/scale-utility.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
coder exp scaletest create-workspaces \
        --retry 5 \
        --count "${SCALETEST_PARAM_NUM_WORKSPACES}" \
        --template "${SCALETEST_PARAM_TEMPLATE}" \
        --concurrency "${SCALETEST_PARAM_CREATE_CONCURRENCY}" \
        --timeout 5h \
        --job-timeout 5h \
        --no-cleanup \
        --output json:"${SCALETEST_RESULTS_DIR}/create-workspaces.json"
```


TITLE: Install PostgreSQL using Helm (In-Cluster)
DESCRIPTION: This set of commands adds the Bitnami Helm repository and then installs PostgreSQL into the Kubernetes cluster within the 'coder' namespace. The installation configures a PostgreSQL instance with specific credentials (username, password, database name) and allocates 10Gi of persistent storage. It's used for development/PoC deployments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/install/rancher.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
helm repo add bitnami https://charts.bitnami.com/bitnami
helm install coder-db bitnami/postgresql \
    --namespace coder \
    --set auth.username=coder \
    --set auth.password=coder \
    --set auth.database=coder \
    --set persistence.size=10Gi
```

TITLE: Defining Resource Costs with coder_metadata - HCL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define costs for Docker volumes and containers within Coder using the `coder_metadata` resource. The `daily_cost` attribute specifies the number of credits consumed per day. When a workspace is shut down, associated resources (like containers) are deleted, reducing the overall cost. The code snippet also illustrates the usage of coder_workspace_owner and coder_workspace data sources to dynamically name resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/users/quotas.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "docker_volume" "home_volume" {
  name = "coder-${data.coder_workspace_owner.me.name}-${data.coder_workspace.me.name}-root"
}

resource "coder_metadata" "home_volume" {
    resource_id = docker_volume.home_volume.id
    daily_cost  = 10
}

resource "docker_container" "workspace" {
  count = data.coder_workspace.me.start_count
  image = "codercom/code-server:latest"
  ...
  volumes {
    container_path = "/home/coder/"
    volume_name    = docker_volume.home_volume.name
    read_only      = false
  }
}

resource "coder_metadata" "workspace" {
    count       = data.coder_workspace.me.start_count
    resource_id = docker_container.workspace.id
    daily_cost  = 20
}
```

TITLE: Example Informative Startup Script - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell script demonstrates an informative startup script. It echoes messages indicating the command being run and its exit status, and exits if the command fails. This helps debugging by providing clear output in the startup logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coder/coder/blob/main/docs/admin/templates/troubleshooting.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
echo "Running startup script..."
echo "Run: long-running-command"
/path/to/long-running-command
status=$?
echo "Done: long-running-command, exit status: ${status}"
if [ $status -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "Startup script failed, exiting..."
  exit $status
fi
```
